page.title: 01REVIEW:NORTHWEST PENRITH
page.content: The area to the North West of Penrith is predominantly agricultural land. However it contains several important communications arteries,the M6 Motorway,the main London_Glasgow Railway and the old A6 trunk road.Even in Roman times a road ran from their fort at BROCAVVM(Brougham), close to the modern A66, to the fort at VOREDA and then onwards to Carlisle.the river Petteril,one of the tributaries of the river Eden,meanders through the area. There are several overhead power lines running through. There are both private & Council Housing Estates on the North West outskirts of the Town, an agreeable Golf Course,and a hospitable country pub.The northern outskirts of the town comprise a number of Housing Schemes,both Council_owned and privately developed.
